title: Justice Dept. Reaches Out to Ghislaine Maxwell, a Longtime Epstein Associate
summary: The latest effort by Trump subordinates is intended to quell a political crisis precipitated by the department’s announcement that it would not release more files related to the Epstein investigation.

title: Understanding the Epstein Saga
summary: In the swirl of conspiracy theories, it’s hard to tell what’s real.

title: A Trump Executive Order Prompts Park Workers to Report Displays That ‘Disparage’ Americans
summary: Descriptions and displays at scores of parks and historic sites have been flagged for review in connection with an executive order from President Trump.

title: White House Pushes to Block Government Accountability Office Inquiries Into Its Cuts
summary: Republicans are seeking to undermine the Government Accountability Office as it investigates, and considers suing, over the Trump administration’s withholding federal funds.

title: Trump Administration Keeps Pressure on Powell Over Rate Cuts and Renovations
summary: President Trump and his top aides have criticized Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, for his management of both the economy and a $2.5 billion revamp of the central bank’s headquarters.

title: U.S. Says It Will Withdraw From UNESCO, Again
summary: A decision to pull out of UNESCO was the latest move by the Trump administration to cut ties with international organizations.

title: As the Dollar Slides, the Euro Is Picking Up Speed
summary: The euro has been gaining steam as investors seek new havens during geopolitical turmoil.

title: U.S. Steel Producers Raise Prices After Tariffs Stymie Imports
summary: Steel producers like Cleveland Cliffs and Steel Dynamics both said this week that they raised prices after President Trump imposed a 50 percent tariff on imports.

title: G.M. Profit Shrinks on Billion-Dollar Tariff Hit
summary: General Motors was the second auto company this week, after Stellantis, to show the toll that President Trump’s trade policies are taking on the industry.

title: AstraZeneca Joins Pharma Investment Push in U.S. Amid Tariff Threat
summary: The U.K.-based drug maker plans to invest $50 billion in the United States as the industry seeks to appease President Trump.

title: The Missing Boy Whose Case Keeps Coming Back
summary: Etan Patz’s face stared out at America. His disappearance shaped childhoods for decades.

title: A Professor’s Search for the MingKwai, a Lost Chinese Typewriter
summary: A history professor went down an 18-year rabbit hole in search of obsolete machines. But there was one he thought he’d never find.

title: In Virginia, the Attack on University Presidents Widens
summary: Gregory Washington, the first Black president of George Mason University, is under fire for his promotion of campus diversity.

title: Israel Expands Attacks in Central Gaza City and Raids W.H.O. Offices
summary: The aid agency says its buildings in the central part of the territory were attacked after the military targeted Deir al-Balah, which had largely been spared.

title: Iran’s Leaders Turn to a New Brand of Nationalism After Israeli and U.S. Attacks
summary: The theocratic government is repurposing folklore and patriotic anthems as it seeks to channel national outrage into increasing its support at home.

title: Fiona Hill on Trump, Putin and Why Great Powers Fall
summary: The former White House aide recently returned to her roots, advising Britain on defense and taking a role at Durham University in northeastern England. She still has her eye on global threats.

title: Russia and Ukraine to Renew Talks, but Peace Remains Elusive
summary: Russia and Ukraine are expected to hold another round of negotiations on Wednesday in Istanbul, but the two warring countries have flatly rejected each other’s demands.

title: Zelensky’s Government Takes Aim at Ukraine’s Corruption Fighters
summary: Ukraine’s president ran on a promise to clean things up, but critics say his government is cracking down on anti-corruption activists, critics and agencies.

title: Edith Chapin, NPR’s Top Editor, Is Stepping Down
summary: Edith Chapin, who is also acting chief content officer, has been editor in chief of the public radio network since 2023.

title: How Does Podcast Star Joe Budden Make $20 Million a Year?
summary: Joe Budden, a former rapper who now oversees a robust podcast network, gave a rare look into the finances of the industry.

title: As Theo Huxtable, Malcolm-Jamal Warner Grew Up Before Our Eyes
summary: The character’s journey into adulthood was at the center of “The Cosby Show.” Here are five memorable episodes from the show’s run.

title: Many Lung Cancers Are Now in Nonsmokers. Scientists Want to Know Why.
summary: The face of lung cancer — once older men with a history of smoking — has changed.

title: Restaurant Review: Chez Fifi on the Upper East Side
summary: Chez Fifi is both a hot spot and a demure neighborhood restaurant, serving a classic French menu that draws crowds from uptown and downtown.

title: In the Spirit of Labubus, Cute Sidekicks Are Taking Over Major Movies
summary: In hit after hit, adorable monsters — as chaotic and cuddly as the popular accessory — have fulfilled moviegoers’ need for escapism.

title: Trump Wants to Put America First. He Has No Idea How.
summary: At the bottom of the president’s foreign policy is a curious void.

title: Are the Democrats Dead or Alive?
summary: Trump’s approval rating is falling. It’s not helping the Democrats much.

title: Video Taken by Migrant Shows Overcrowded ICE Holding Cell in Manhattan
summary: Immigrants have complained about unsanitary conditions in the facility at 26 Federal Plaza, including paltry meals and a lack of showers.

title: Bangladesh Mourns After Deadly Plane Crash During School Lunch Break
summary: Nearly all of the 31 killed when a Bangladeshi fighter jet crashed were children. Dozens more were being treated in burn centers as the nation declared a day of mourning.

title: U.S. Is Missing the Century’s ‘Greatest Economic Opportunity,’ U.N. Chief Says
summary: In a speech on renewable energy, António Guterres cited “clear market distortion” in favor of fossil fuels by President Trump and others but called the transition to cleaner energy economically inevitable.

title: As Billionaire Funds an Opera House, Nazi-Era Questions Linger Over His Company
summary: A new home for the Hamburg State Opera is meant to increase the city’s international standing. But some say its choice of funder is out of step with the cultural mood.
